(continuing discussion on archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com)

Judy writes:
> So, overall it looks like the manifest is over-reporting...
> 
> crawl08.archive.org/documenttypes/binaries/ps.ps
> crawl08.archive.org/links/imagemaps/
> These URLs are not linked on any of the pages.

Aha. More evidence that the first thing tested by a test 
plan is the test plan itself. 

> crawl08.archive.org/documenttypes/example-background-image.jpeg 
> This is linked on example-background-image.html, but heritrix is not 
> finding the jpeg which is located in:
> <body background="example-background-image.jpeg">

This is a bug; we're not yet extracting 'background' embeds. Please
enter into bug db (if you haven't already) and I'll be able to fix 
it later today.

> http://crawl08.archive.org/documenttypes/binaries
> This is throwing a 403 error.

Is this just listed in the manifest or also linked from test pages?

> And finally, if you specify a directory without the "/" at the end, it 
> returns a 301 response (Moved Permanently) and then redirects to the "/".  
> I don't know if this is a problem or not, but the manifest is 
> reporting quite a few of those.

If Heritrix running-from-seeds, following-links gets the same 
pattern of responses, that's fine. If on the other hand the 
test page links already include the trailing "/"s, then the 
manifest should include the trailing "/"s too. After all, 3XX
responses are archived/logged too.

Good catches!

- Gordon

> Judy
> 
> 
> On Wed, 16 Jul 2003, Parker Thompson wrote:
> 
> > Judy,
> > 
> > There is a file called MANIFEST-20030716162217-0.arc.gz in the directory:
> > 
> >   /0/cvs_webcrawler_nightly_build/CrawlerTesting/Heritrix/
> > 
> > on crawl08 that has the crawl of the manifest.  This should be useful for
> > comparison, though I may be +/- a few links at this point.  If you could
> > do the comparison when you have a chance that would be cool.
> > 
> > Oh, and I made a few changes to the garden, so perhaps this can be done
> > after tomorrow morning's crawl so you get the freshest fresh.  But, I
> > don't think this is hugely time-critial anyway.
> > 
> > thanks much,
> > 
> > pt.
> > 
>
